texts.content_text1: Before you get to the lecture, let's worm up and have a guess:
texts.content_text100: Child-friendly justice means treating children exactly the same as adults in court.
texts.content_text300: Children must receive special treatment in courts
texts.content_text101: Children should be allowed to express their views during legal proceedings.
texts.content_text301: They have the right to express all their views!
texts.content_text102: Using complex legal language helps children understand the seriousness of the situation.
texts.content_text302: Children must be able to understand the legal language!
texts.content_text103: A child’s emotional well-being is as important as the legal outcome of the case.
texts.content_text104: Legal professionals should adapt procedures to make children feel safe and comfortable.
texts.content_text105: Building trust with a child (for example by talking about school or hobbies) is part of a lawyer’s role.
texts.content_text106: Protecting children’s dignity is a key principle of child-friendly justice.
